newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian shares hit by political worries.
newsitem.headline: Indian shares hit by political worries.

text.p: Indian share prices fell broadly on Thursday in jittery trade triggered by fresh worries of political uncertainty, brokers said.

They said sellers outnumbered buyers in sluggish trade after a court rejected an anticipatory bail request by former prime minister P.V. Narasimha Rao against possible arrest in a criminal conspiracy case.
After the market closed Indian news agencies reported that federal police filed fresh charges against Rao in a seven-year old forgery case.

The 30-share Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) index ended 36.87 points, or 1.10 percent, lower at 3,307.05 off the day's low of 3,293.71. The 50-stock National Stock Exchange (NSE) index dropped 11.98 points, or 1.23 percent, to 959.31.
The minority coalition government of Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda depends on the support of Rao's Congress party.
State-owned insurance firms were the only net buyers.

SBI fell 5.0 rupees to 259.25 on the BSE and analysts said a further fall could mar its $400 million global depositary receipt issue which was expected to be priced at a premium to the underlying stock.
IPCL fell 7.0 to 115 after its chief said he expects a net profit of 2.2 billion rupees in the first six months to September 30, 1996 against 3.05 billion in the year-ago period.
ACC fell 48 rupees to 1,805, TELCO 4.75 to 454.75, Reliance 3.25 to 193.75 and Bajaj Auto 4.75 to 985.25.
The 500-share CRISIL index shed 7.41 points to 642.22.
The Delhi index dropped 9.39 points to 727.92. Hindustan Lever was down 13 rupees at 812.
The Calcutta index shed 2.32 points to 423.81 and the Madras index fell 12.35 points to 3,408.97.
